file_content.text: It's nice to be warm for a change, isn't it?
Well, Captain? The air is definitely warmer, don't you think?
You mean... you were successful? You diverted the springs?
Indeed we did. No thanks to you.
But all thanks to you. I don't think I'm exaggerating when I say the people of this base owe you their lives.
No problem.
No need for modesty. We've finally got insurance against the cold.
I'm the best there is.
Yes. Yes, I suppose you are. I'm going to tell everyone what you did here.
I'll be going then.
Of course. And thank you again. The Empire can attack our shipments all they want now--it won't matter.
I... I owe you an apology, Teilo. I really didn't think you'd pull this off. Well done. Well done to all of you.
That's it. You've managed to divert all the springs. You can return to the base now.
That's the second one done. Should we go for the full set?
I'm enjoying this.
Carry on.
I think that's enough. We should head back to the base.
Let's go back.
As you wish. The springs you diverted there should be enough to heat the base. Or so I hope.
That's the first hole drilled. What do you think? Should we go for number two?
We'll keep going.
Let's carry on
Excellent. The more holes you drill, the higher our chance of success.
I think that's enough. We should head back to the base.
Let's go back.
As you wish. The springs you diverted there should be enough to heat the base. Or so I hope.
You should really get a move on.
Four of our best engineers--dead! I would never have authorized a mission like that.
Then it's lucky I don't need your permission! We're freezing to death, and we have to address the heating situation.
I'll fund the next expedition myself. Just send a squad of soldiers for protection.
You're asking me to risk my men over an unproven theory.
It's not unproven--sir! Perfect timing. Would you consider protecting me? Say yes, and this base could have a permanent source of natural heat.
It's not unproven--Master Jedi! Perfect timing. Would you consider protecting me? Say yes, and this base could have a permanent source of natural heat.
It's not unproven--ah! Come over here. Would you consider protecting me? Say yes, and this base could have a permanent source of natural heat.
What are you talking about?
I have a plan to make this base self-sufficient.
Doesn't feel like we've got a heating problem.
Feels warm enough to me.
That's because our fuel reserves are back to full capacity. It won't last.
You'll need protection from me if you don't back off.
Get out of my face. Now.
Oh--please forgive Teilo. He can get carried away, but the heating problem is real.
Last month, two fuel shipments were destroyed by the Empire, and our reserves ran out. Thirty-eight cases of hypothermia. Eleven deaths.
But by drilling into the ice, we can divert a series of hot springs beneath the base. Our heating problems would be over.
Teilo's a brilliant engineer, but drilling into the ice fields for hot water just... sounds crazy to me.
A permanent source of heat on a world as cold as this is worth a little danger.
It may be worth the risk.
How is making holes in the ground going to divert these springs?
Will drilling really work?
The inrush of air will create new pathways for the water. We just need protection while we're busy.
You just don't want to risk your skin.
I think you're scared.
I'm being cautious, that's all!
The ice fields are a no-man's-land swarming with Imperial snipers and shock troops. My men can't escort an engineering team.
Maybe I don't need your men. What about it, people? Willing to put your life on the line to save hundreds from freezing?
Maybe I don't need your men. What about it, Captain? Willing to put your life on the line to save hundreds of people from freezing?
I've had plenty of experience watching out for troops on the battlefield. Don't worry about a thing.
You can count on me
Maybe I don't need your men. So, Master Jedi? Willing to put your life on the line to save hundreds of people from freezing?
No one will get near you and your men.
I'll do it.
I will protect you to my last dying breath.
Your life is safe with me.
Maybe I don't need your men. What about it? Willing to put your life on the line to save hundreds of people from freezing?
If it makes this place any warmer, then count me in.
Sure thing.
Captain? I'm willing to help, but it's your call.
If the captain permits it.
If you can pull this off, great. It's just a little too uncertain for my tastes.
Thank you! You're doing the right thing.
There are three prime locations to drill. One should be sufficient, but all three would guarantee success.
Sorry. [Refuse quest]
You see? I'm not being unreasonable. Even an impartial observer agrees.
Remember this, Captain. The next time our people freeze for lack of fuel, their deaths are on your head.
I can't talk right now. I'm in the middle of something.
